articles.title: NTPC Renewable starts 75.50 MW commercial supply from Khavda-I solar project
articles.content: Listen to this article in summarized format Listen Loading... √ó √ó Subscribe to Unlock AI Briefing and Premium Content Subscribe Now What's Included Exclusive Stories Daily ePaper Access Smart Market Tools Curated Investment Ideas Ad-lite Experience Subscription ANI State-owned power giant NTPC on Wednesday said its step-down subsidiary NTPC Renewable Energy has begun commercial supply of electricity from a part of the capacity of 75.50 MW out of the 1,255 MW Khavda-I solar PV project in Gujarat. With this, the total installed and commercial capacity of the NTPC group has become 84,924 MW, a regulatory filing said. According to the statement, the company informed about the declaration of the commercial operation date of part capacity of 75.50 MW out of 1,255 MW Khavda-I Solar PV Project under CPSU scheme Phase-II Tranche-III in Gujarat of NTPC Renewable Energy Ltd, a step-down subsidiary of NTPC Ltd , through its subsidiary NTPC Green Energy Ltd, from November 19, 2025. Earlier this month, NTPC announced that it has raised its installed generation capacity target from 130 GW to 149 GW by 2032 and 244 GW by 2037. Add as a Reliable and Trusted News Source Add Now! articles.title: RRB NTPC undergraduate CBT-1 result 2025 expected soon: check steps, vacancies and exam details
articles.content: TOI.in Representational image RRB NTPC undergraduate CBT-1 result 2025: The Railway Recruitment Board (RRB) is expected to release the Non-Technical Popular Categories (NTPC) Computer Based Test (CBT)-1 Undergraduate (UG) results before the fourth week of November 2025. Candidates can check and download their results on the official website, rrbcdg.gov.in. Also Read- RRB Group D city intimation slips 2025 released Candidates who qualify in the Commercial cum Ticket Clerk and Trains Clerk CBT-1 exams will appear for the CBT-II examination. For posts such as Accounts Clerk-cum-Typist and Junior Clerk-cum-Typist, a Typing Skill Test is part of the second stage of the selection process. Upon clearing both stages, candidates will undergo document verification and a medical examination. Selected candidates are liable for active service in the Railway Engineers‚Äô Unit of the Territorial Army. RRB NTPC UG CBT-1 Vacancies and salary The total number of vacancies for RRB NTPC UG posts is 3,445. This includes 2,022 for Commercial cum Ticket Clerk, 361 for Accounts Clerk-cum-Typist, 990 for Junior Clerk-cum-Typist, and 72 for Trains Clerk. The Commercial cum Ticket Clerk post offers an initial salary of Rs. 21,700, while other posts start at Rs. 19,900. RRB NTPC UG CBT-1 exam details The CBT-I examination was conducted between August 7 and September 9, 2025. The exam comprised 100 multiple-choice questions, including 40 questions from General Awareness, 30 from Mathematics, and 30 from General Intelligence and Reasoning. The duration of the test was 90 minutes, and a negative marking scheme of one-third of the marks was applied for incorrect answers. Live Events How to download RRB NTPC UG CBT-1 result 2025 Candidates can follow these steps to check and download the result: Visit the official website rrbcdg.gov.in. On the homepage, click on ‚ÄúNTPC Under Graduate Scorecard 2025‚Äù or ‚ÄúNTPC Under Graduate Result 2025.‚Äù Enter the registration number, date of birth, and captcha code. Click on ‚ÄúLogin‚Äù to view the result. Download and save the result for future reference. Add as a Reliable and Trusted News Source Add Now! articles.title: SC dismisses Avantha Holdings's appeal against NTPC‚Äôs resolution plan for takeover of Jhabua Power
articles.content: Listen to this article in summarized format Listen Loading... √ó √ó Subscribe to Unlock AI Briefing and Premium Content Subscribe Now What's Included Exclusive Stories Daily ePaper Access Smart Market Tools Curated Investment Ideas Ad-lite Experience Subscription ET Bureau The Supreme Court on Tuesday dismissed the Avantha Holdings 's appeal against state-owned NTPC ‚Äôs resolution plan for takeover of debt-ridden Jhabua Power . A Bench comprising Justices Sanjay Kumar and Alok Aradhe upheld the National Company Law Appellate Tribunal‚Äôs order that rejected Avantha Holdings' plea for a settlement proposal of the debt-ridden firm. Avantha Holdings is the promoter and shareholder of Avantha Power and Infrastructure, which holds 17.9% shares of Jhabua Power. The appellate tribunal in its July 2022 order held that the promoter who led to insolvency process of corporate debtor cannot claim to submit a resolution plan indirectly and ask the lenders to evaluate its resolution plan. NTPC has already acquired 600 MW thermal power plant of Jhabua Power in Seoni, Madhya Pradesh for Rs 925 crore and also implemented its resolution plan. Avantha Holdings had also sought the disqualification of NTPC under Section 29A of the Insolvency and Bankruptcy Code , 2016, from the Corporate Insolvency Resolution Process for Jhabua Power, saying the provision bars certain individuals and entities from submitting a resolution plan for a distressed company. Further, Avantha Holdings had challenged the decision of Jhabua Power's committee of creditors to reject its restructuring and settlement proposal for the debt-ridden company. It said that its settlement plan had not been considered by the CoC by any application of mind and it had been arbitrarily rejected. Live Events Besides, Avantha Holdings told the court that two joint ventures of NTPC ‚Äì Ratnagiri Gas and Power and Konkan LNG ‚Äì had already been classified as non-performing assets, and thus, NTPC was disqualified in the insolvency proceedings of Jhabua Power by virtue of Section 29A(c) and Section 29A(j) of the 2016 code. NTPC, however, argued that it was eligible to submit the Plan and CoC with a due deliberations on the Resolution Plan, approved it with 100% vote. The Canara Bank had classified Ratnagiri Gas and Power and Konkan LNG as non-performing assets in 2018, and by then, the one-year period from the date of commencement of insolvency proceedings had not elapsed, so disqualification under Section 29A(c) was not attracted, it said. The entire debt of Konkan LNG was settled through a one-time settlement in 2020, and all lenders had issued no due certificates as there was no old dues, the PSU argued. The Kolkata bench of the National Company Law Tribunal in 2019 had initiated insolvency proceedings against Jhabua Power on a petition by FLSmidth and appointed Abhilash Lal as the Resolution Professional. While Avantha Holdings in 2020 had made a proposal to the committee of creditors (CoC) for the settlement of debt owed by Jhabua Power, the lenders in June 2021 found the NTPC resolution plan to be compliant. Even the tribunal in 2021 approved the NTPC's plan as it found it feasible and viable. It rejected the Avantha Holdings' settlement plan for being commercially unviable and not prudent. Also, the NCLT rejected Avantha Holdings‚Äô application seeking the NTPC ‚Äôs disqualification. Even the NCLAT rejected Avantha Holdings' appeal, saying ‚Äúsomething which is not permissible directly by virtue of prohibition under Section 29A for submitting resolution plan by the promoters, cannot be permitted to be done indirectly. Further, the commercial wisdom of the CoC, is not liable to be judicially reviewed,‚Äù the appellate tribunal held. Add as a Reliable and Trusted News Source Add Now!
